Bats provide important pest suppression services to Vermont farmers. A 2011 study estimates that the value of bats to Vermont’s agricultural industry is $32.1 million each year. @USFWS
Other bats in Vermont are the little brown bat, tricolored bat, eastern small-footed bat, silver-haired bat, hoary bat, and the eastern red bat.
Another #BatWeek sundown is here. There are 9 species of bats in #VT, and 2 are threatened and endangered species—The Indiana bat and the northern long-eared bat.

For decades Congress has failed to address our aging infrastructure. This supply chain crisis illustrates the cost of inaction. If we want to grow+prosper in the 21st century, we need a more modern & efficient infra system. That's what the bipartisan infrastructure bill delivers.

The bipartisan infrastructure bill includes billions to upgrade & modernize our port infrastructure. It also increases funding for our freight system, our roads & bridges, railways & our nation’s airports - all of which are crucial to the movement of goods throughout the country.

Taken together, this crisis clearly demonstrates why infrastructure investment is so important to the health and vitality of our US economy. And it illustrates the urgent need for the House of Reps. to pass the Infrastructure Investment and #Jobs Act without further delay.
For years we have ignored our ports - allowing them to age and deteriorate, while at the same time their usage has increased at a staggering rate. Now we are paying the price.

We are in the midst of one of the worst supply chain crises in recent memory. 

While there are a number of contributing factors, one culprit - at least here in the U.S. - is our aging and insufficient port infrastructure.
